revised_title: Chemical Analysis of Zoophytes and the Nature of Membrane Components
tldr: Charles Hatchett investigates the chemical composition of various zoophytes and membrane components, discovering that their differences lie in the nature and quantity of the hardening or ossifying principle and the state of the substance with which it is mixed. He also concludes that gelatin and animal fiber are derived from the primary animal matter, albumen, which undergoes various modifications to form the diverse parts of animal bodies.
